lead: Education continues to evolve with the influence of technology and the recognition of historical contributions in the field. From the obsolescence of legacy software in enterprise environments to the celebration of pioneering figures like Dr. Gladys West, the landscape of education is shaped by both innovation and recognition of past achievements.

stories.title: Last rites for perpetual enterprise software licenses?
stories.summary: The article discusses the inevitable end of perpetual enterprise software licenses, emphasizing the shift towards cloud-based solutions. As legacy systems become unsupported, organizations face increased risks and costs. The transition to subscription models is framed not just as a business strategy but as a necessary engineering practice to ensure security and functionality in a rapidly changing technological landscape.

stories.title: Dr. Gladys West, whose mathematical models inspired GPS, dies at 95
stories.summary: Dr. Gladys West, a pioneering mathematician whose work laid the groundwork for GPS technology, has passed away at 95. Despite facing systemic barriers, she excelled in mathematics and contributed significantly to satellite data modeling. Her legacy highlights the importance of recognizing contributions from diverse figures in STEM, especially women of color, who have historically been overlooked.

stories.title: The Role of Technology in Modern Education
stories.summary: This article explores how technology has transformed education, making learning more accessible and engaging. Tools like online platforms and interactive software allow for personalized learning experiences. The integration of technology in classrooms is essential for preparing students for a digital future, emphasizing the need for educators to adapt to these changes.

stories.title: Innovative Teaching Methods for the 21st Century
stories.summary: Education Week discusses various innovative teaching methods that are reshaping classrooms today. Techniques such as project-based learning and flipped classrooms encourage critical thinking and collaboration among students. These approaches are essential in fostering a learning environment that meets the demands of modern society.

stories.title: The Importance of STEM Education
stories.summary: Forbes highlights the critical role of STEM education in preparing students for future careers. As technology continues to advance, a strong foundation in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics is vital. The article advocates for increased investment in STEM programs to ensure students are equipped with the necessary skills to thrive in a tech-driven economy.

stories.title: How to Foster a Growth Mindset in Students
stories.summary: TeachThought provides insights on fostering a growth mindset among students, which is crucial for their academic and personal development. Encouraging resilience and a love for learning can lead to better outcomes in education. The article outlines practical strategies for educators to implement this mindset in their teaching practices.

stories.title: The Future of Online Learning
stories.summary: Inside Higher Ed examines the future of online learning, particularly in the wake of the pandemic. As institutions adapt to hybrid models, the importance of maintaining engagement and quality in online education is emphasized. The article discusses trends and challenges that will shape the landscape of higher education moving forward.

stories.title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Education
stories.summary: EdSurge explores how artificial intelligence is revolutionizing education, from personalized learning experiences to administrative efficiencies. AI tools are being integrated into classrooms to enhance teaching and learning processes. The article also addresses the ethical considerations and challenges that come with implementing AI in educational settings.
